Called Update local admin based on cell value changes.
True if the value change is allowed, False to block the value change.
This method differs from OnCellValueEdited; during a cell value change notification (at the end of an edit operation) it is unsafe to modify the value of the cell being edited. However, the end edit event will not be triggered for particular specialized cells which makes this method mandatory. We once again apologize for the confusion; )

Called when the user has finished editing a cell. Handled to update local admin based on cell value changes.
True if the edit operation is allowed, False to cancel the edit operation.
This method differs from OnCellValueChanged; at the end of an edit operation it is once again safe to alter the value of the cell that was just edited for text and combo box controls. *sigh*

member.name: T:ScientificInterface.Ecospace.Basemap.Layers.cLayer
member.summary: Class that wraps a single Ecospace data layer for manipulation in a User Interface.

remarks.para: Ok, the UI layer thing has gotten so complex that a bit of an explanation would not hurt.

The entire basemap chain consists of the following collaborating classes:
One basemap which defines the size and other aspects of the map currently active in Ecospace. This class also provides access to individual data layers.
Several data layers which each expose spatial array(s) of data. Basemap layers are two dimensional, allowing access to the array via cell(row, col) interaction. Poking around in a basemap layer in fact modifies Ecospace spatial cells of spatial data array that the the layer is connected to.
To obtain a layer from the basemap, call cEcospaceBasemap.Layers or one of the Layer-exposing properties of that class.
GUI Layers combine one or more core basemap layers as a single unit for display and interaction in the user interface. The GUI Layer uses a layer renderer to decide how this assembly of core data is reflected.
To standardize the use of layers, the GUI provides a factory class that delivers layers in a standardized way. To obtain one or more layers, call GetLayers.
You can also create your own layers if need be, but try to use the factory whenever possible.

members.member:
===========================================================================
Dialog class implementing the Edit Group Taxon interface.
Note that this class breaks the EwE/Core/Plugin convention that all interaction with plug-ins should happen via the plug-in manager!
This class directly interfaces wit the plug-in manager to find taxonomy data producing search engines. These plug-ins are directly called to execute searches and to scoop up search results. This is all very neat, but this means that the core will not be able to use this behaviour at all.
This crucial behavour should probably be contained within a core class called 'cDataSearchManager(Of T)'. This will yield generic behaviour that can be used for other purposes at core level.
===========================================================================

members.member:
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Constructor, initializes a new instanze of this class.
The cEcospaceMPA to initialize this instance from. If set, this instance represents a MPA currently active in the EwE model. -------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Overridden to first create a snapshot of the MPA/stanza configuration in the current EwE model. The grid will be populated from this local administration.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Called Update local admin based on cell value changes.
True if the value change is allowed, False to block the value change.
This method differs from OnCellValueEdited; during a cell value change notification (at the end of an edit operation) it is unsafe to modify the value of the cell being edited. However, the end edit event will not be triggered for particular specialized cells which makes this method mandatory. We once again apologize for the confusion; )
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Called when the user has finished editing a cell. Handled to update local admin based on cell value changes.
True if the edit operation is allowed, False to cancel the edit operation.
This method differs from OnCellValueChanged; at the end of an edit operation it is once again safe to alter the value of the cell that was just edited for text and combo box controls. *sigh*
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: P:ScientificInterface.My.Resources.Resources.PROMPT_ERROR_IMPORT_EWE5_TOO_OLD
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to This database was written by an outdated version of Ecopath 5, which is not supported by the EwE6 import process.
Download and install a recent version of Ecopath 5 to update your database. Once updated, EwE6 will be able to import the database to its new database format.
Ecopath 5 can be downloaded from http://ecopath.org/, follow the download links..

member.name: P:ScientificInterface.My.Resources.Resources.PROMPT_ERROR_IMPORT_EWE6_TOO_NEW
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to This database was last accessed by a newer release of Ecopath with Ecosim. It is advised to download and install a new version of EwE from http://www.ecopath.org and try again.
EwE can attempt to continue and load the model in read-only mode, but this may not work. Do you wish to try this? You may need to grab a helmet..

members.member:
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Refresh the control to the core content.
This method should be called whenever this number of groups in the core has changed. The control will not keep track of the number of groups itself.
-------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------
Get or set the block colours that this control should reflect. The number of available block colours is set to the number of colours passed to this property.
-------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------
Returns the 2-dimensional array of vulnerability block values that this control maintains. This one-based array is dimensioned by the number of groups in the core.
-------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------
Helper method, fills a range of block code cells with a given block code value.
The index of the predator block to fill. The index of the prey block to fill. The block code value to fill with.
Fill will behave as follows:
When a non-zero predator and prey cell are given, a single cell is filled.
When a non-zero predator and zero prey cell are given, a predator column is filled.
When a zero predator and non-zero prey cell are given, a prey row is filled.
When both predator and prey are zero, the entire grid is filled with the given block code value.
-------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------
Process mouse hover info to show and populate a tooltip or to hide when applicable.
The hover point to update the tooltip for.
The tooltip is hidden if the hover point is absent, or the given hover location indicates an invalid predator and prey index.
-------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------
Helper method; calculates pred/prey index from a given point in the control.
The point to request predator and prey index for. A point holding the predator index (X) and prey index (Y) for the requested point. -------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
User control that implements a grid of coloured cells. Every cell can be assigned a block value in a graphical interface. The number of available blocks and the graphical representation of each block is defined via BlockColors.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------

if (
The group index to get the formula for. The habitat index to get the formula for. A cExpression containing the formula. -------------------------------------------------------------------

Event handler, catches the form closing event to make sure the core is finalized. Application shut-down is cancelled if the core does not finalize correctly.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Set the application status strip text and wait cursor.
Status text to display, if any.
Flag stating whether a wait cursor should be shown. Values are interpreted as follows:
: wait cursor will be set.
: wait cursor will be cleared.
: wait cursor state will not change.
Ratio [0, 1] of progress to display. 0 to hide progress.
Note that the wait cursor state is maintained via an internal counter. Setting the wait cursor state will increment this counter, clearing the wait cursor state decrements the counter. The actual wait cursor will be set when this counter is non-zero, and is cleared when this counter reaches zero.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

=======================================================================
Form providing the interface to sketch fishing mortality.
VC email 18/04/2009:
The option of having effort or F as input is confusing people (I clearly saw in Fish 501). Also, when one modifies F it is not saved, but overwritten with effort. That’s OK.
We need to keep the code for running F as input as this is useful when reading time series. However, we do not need to have it as in input. I’ve discussed this with Carl, and he agrees. Changes to be made:
On Ecosim input menu, Move “fishing effort” to be at the level of Egg production, and placed just below it. Delete the Fishing mortality (under Fishing rate)
On Ecosim output; run Ecosim: keep the ‘target’ but when users select a Group to see the grey fishing mortalities, these should not be modifiable, just for showing. (One should still be able to edit the fishing efforts by fleets though)
That’s all. So from now on, F is either calculated from effort, or read in via a time series. This should reduce confusion.
JS reply 18/04/2009:
Should fishing mortality move to the Ecosim output nodes as a read-only form?
VS reply 19/04/2009:
Good idea, so yes.
JS 18/02/2011: F sketching enabled again after repeated requests.
=======================================================================

member.name: F:ScientificInterface.Ecosim.gridRegulatoryOptions.m_iUpdateLock
member.summary: Update lock, used to distinguish between code updates and user updates of grid cells. When grid cells are updated from within the code, an update lock should be active to prevent edit/update recursion.

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Called Update local admin based on cell value changes.
True if the value change is allowed, False to block the value change.
This method differs from OnCellValueEdited; during a cell value change notification (at the end of an edit operation) it is unsafe to modify the value of the cell being edited. However, the end edit event will not be triggered for particular specialized cells which makes this method mandatory.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Update lock, should be set when modifying cell values from the code to prevent recursive update/notification loops.
True when no update lock is active.
Update locks are cumulative: setting this lock twice will require clearing it twice to allow updates to happen.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------
Constructor, initializes a new instanze of this class.
The cPedigreeLevel to initialize this instance from. If set, this instance represents a Level currently active in the EwE model. -------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------
Get/set the list index of a level in the local manager.
This is a LOCAL value for use in the EditPedigree grid context only, and bears little relationship to cPedigreeLevel.Index.
-------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------
States whether the underlying pedigree level has been changed.
True if the underlying pedigree level has been changed.
-------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Overridden to first create a snapshot of the Level/stanza configuration in the current EwE model. The grid will be populated from this local administration.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Called when the user has finished editing a cell. Handled to update local admin based on cell value changes.
True if the edit operation is allowed, False to cancel the edit operation.
This method differs from OnCellValueChanged; at the end of an edit operation it is once again safe to alter the value of the cell that was just edited for text and combo box controls. *sigh*
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Delete a row from the grid
The index of the row to delete. Flag stating the new row state. UseDefault will perform a true toggle, True will delete the row, and False will undelete the row.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

NxN array of single to copy from. Layer to copy to. Variable to convert non-negative values to, or cCore.NULL_VALUE to directly copy the values. -------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------
Convert 'iAreaPercentToClose' cells in the map to MPA 'iMPA'
The best count map to convert. Percent of water cells to close in addition to the current MPAs. The MPA to assign new cells to. True if succesful.
Cells are selected from the best count map, aiMap, by descending value until either the requested percentage is met or there are no convertable cells left.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
